intro: Norysca punctata, commonly known as the spotted norysca, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive white spots. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and purple, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Norysca punctata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
